title: Weekend Reading 3.16.25
description: This is the first weekend I’ve been home in a month! I was away the past three weekends, first we visited my daughter in Santa Barbara, next we ran away on a 4 day trip to Kauai, and then we drove up north to visit our son at his university. Finally, a weekend to enjoy… Keep Reading →
author: Kate Riley
excerpt: This is the first weekend I’ve been home in a month! I was away the past three weekends, first we visited my daughter in Santa Barbara, next we ran away on ...
text: This is the first weekend I’ve been home in a month! I was away the past three weekends, first we visited my daughter in Santa Barbara, next we ran away on a 4 day trip to Kauai, and then we drove up north to visit our son at his university. Finally, a weekend to enjoy being at home! I can feel spring in the air, we had a few days of sunshine and the trees are beginning to bud, but there is still rain in the forecast. I’ve been at my law firm for five months now, I’ve learned so much, but I confess I miss this blog and and I miss having more time to be creative. I need to be better about budgeting more time for creativity. Thankfully I can work remotely so now that the time change allows for more daylight in the evenings, my plan is come home early and spend an hour gardening, making art, and little updates around the house. Happy early spring friends :) Favorite links spied this week: This elevated A frame renovation. This color and pattern filled Florida coastal home. The modern style on display in this builder’s portfolio. Creative use of AI: Barbie dreamhouses from every state. Wow I love every detail in this kitchen remodel. Warm weather is coming! Covered porch design ideas. What your home decor says about your personality. Vintage decor making a comeback in 2025. 25 picturesque towns in Europe. Do you agree with these 50 etiquette rules?
html:
This is the first weekend I’ve been home in a month! I was away the past three weekends, first we visited my daughter in Santa Barbara, next we ran away on a 4 day trip to Kauai, and then we drove up north to visit our son at his university. Finally, a weekend to enjoy being at home! I can feel spring in the air, we had a few days of sunshine and the trees are beginning to bud, but there is still rain in the forecast.

I’ve been at my law firm for five months now, I’ve learned so much, but I confess I miss this blog and and I miss having more time to be creative. I need to be better about budgeting more time for creativity. Thankfully I can work remotely so now that the time change allows for more daylight in the evenings, my plan is come home early and spend an hour gardening, making art, and little updates around the house. Happy early spring friends :)

Favorite links spied this week:

This elevated A frame renovation.

This color and pattern filled Florida coastal home.

The modern style on display in this builder’s portfolio.

Creative use of AI: Barbie dreamhouses from every state.

Wow I love every detail in this kitchen remodel.

Warm weather is coming! Covered porch design ideas.

Vintage decor making a comeback in 2025.

25 picturesque towns in Europe.
